sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词或词组均含"抛弃，放弃"之意
sameAnalysis.word_list: abandon, desert, forsake, leave, give up
means: abandon ：强调永远或完全放弃或抛弃人或事物等，这可能是被迫的，也可能是自愿的。
desert ：着重指违背法律责任和义务，或自己的信仰与誓言的行为，多含非难的意味。
forsake ：侧重断绝感情上的依恋，自愿抛弃所喜欢的人或物。也指抛弃信仰或改掉恶习。
leave ：普通用词，指舍弃某事或某一职业，或终止同一某人的关系，但不涉及动机与果。
give up ：普通用语，侧重指没有希望或因外界压力而放弃。

word_mean: 为流沙、沙丘所覆盖的地区。

sentence.Network_en: The vehicles have been modified to suit conditions in the desert.
sentence.Network_cn: 车辆已改装过以适应沙漠的环境。

sentence.Network_en: The paper'sprice rise will encourage readers to desert in even greater numbers.

sentence.Network_en: Young workers are more willing to desert jobs they don't like.
sentence.Network_cn: 年轻职工对不喜欢的工作更易擅自离职。

jx.jx_en_mean: receive the appropriate reward or (more usually)　punishment for one's actions

lj.lj_ly: those who caused great torment to others rarely got their just deserts.
lj.lj_ls: 那些给他人带来巨大痛苦的人很少受到应受的惩罚。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French deserter, from late Latin desertare, from Latin desertus 'left waste' (see desert)
Middle English: via Old French from late Latin desertum 'something left waste', neuter past participle of deserere 'leave, forsake'
Middle English: via Old French from deservir 'serve well' (see deserve

encyclopedia.content: desert 英['dezət]美['dezət] v. 1.[T]离弃（一地方），放弃，遗弃，离弃（某人），抛弃 2.[I,T]擅自离开（尤指军中或船上的职守）， 逃跑，潜逃 3.[T]在关键时使（某人）失望 n. [C, U]沙漠， 荒漠，荒原 v. 1.[T]离弃（一地方），放弃，遗弃，离弃（某人），抛弃 2.[I,T]擅自离开（尤指军中或船上的职守）， 逃跑，潜逃 3.[T]在关键时使（某人）失望 n. [C, U]沙漠， 荒漠，荒原 名 词：deserter 动 词：dese

entry.def: A desert is a large area of land, usually in a hot region, where there is almost no water, rain, trees, or plants.

entry.tran: 枯燥乏味的地方（或境况）
entry.def: If you refer to a place or situation as a desert, you think it is bad for people because it is not interesting, exciting, or useful in any way.

example.ex: They live in 12 high-rise apartment buildings that sit in a desert of concrete...
example.tran: 他们居住的地方是坐落于一片钢筋水泥丛林中的12栋高层公寓楼。

entry.def: If people or animals desert a place, they leave it and it becomes empty.

example.ex: Farmers are deserting their fields and coming here looking for jobs...
example.tran: 小农场主正舍弃他们的土地，到这里来寻找工作。

example.ex: After the show, the audience deserts the Blackpool streets.
example.tran: 演出结束后，观众从布莱克浦的大街上消失了踪迹。

entry.def: If someone deserts you, they go away and leave you, and no longer help or support you.

example.ex: Mrs Roding's husband deserted her years ago...
example.tran: 罗丁太太的丈夫数年前抛弃了她。

example.ex: He has been deserted by most of his advisers.
example.tran: 他的大多数顾问都弃他而去。

entry.def: If you desert something that you support, use, or are involved with, you stop supporting it, using it, or being involved with it.

example.ex: The paper's price rise will encourage readers to desert in even greater numbers...
example.tran: 报纸价格的上涨将导致更多的读者不再订阅。

example.ex: He was pained to see many youngsters deserting kibbutz life...
example.tran: 看到那么多的年轻人放弃了合作农场的生活，他感到很痛心。

entry.def: If a quality or skill that you normally have deserts you, you suddenly find that you do not have it when you need it or want it.

example.ex: Even when he appeared to be depressed, a dry sense of humour never deserted him...
example.tran: 即使在他看上去很沮丧的时候，他也从没有丧失过自己的冷面幽默。

example.ex: She lost the next five games, and the set, as her confidence abruptly deserted her.
example.tran: 她突然自信心全失，接下来连败 5 局，并最终丢了这一盘。

entry.tran: 擅离(职守);（尤指从军队)开小差
entry.def: If someone deserts, or deserts a job, especially a job in the armed forces, they leave that job without permission.

example.ex: He was a second-lieutenant in the army until he deserted...
example.tran: 他在擅离部队之前是一名陆军少尉。

example.ex: He deserted from army intelligence last month...
example.tran: 上个月他从陆军情报机关开小差跑了。

entry.def: If you say that someone has got their just deserts, you mean that they deserved the unpleasant things that have happened to them, because they did something bad.

example.ex: At the end of the book the child's true identity is discovered, and the bad guys get their just deserts.
example.tran: 在书的结尾，那个孩子的真实身份大白于世，坏人则得到了应有的惩罚。

means.word_mean: 1. an arid region with little or no vegetation
1. leave someone who needs or counts on you; leave in the lurch;
2. desert (a cause, a country or an army), often in order to join the opposing cause, country, or army;

sentences.sentence: "If soldiers deserted Hitler's army, they were shot"

means.word_mean: 1. located in a dismal or remote area; desolate;

list.explanation: [海湾战争用语]沙漠战的新兵5,000 desert cherries arrived last week. Something is going to happen soon.上周来了5,000名沙漠战新兵。马上会有什么事要发生了。

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Much of the steppe has now turned to desert.

auth_sentence.content: This track is in my desert island top ten.
auth_sentence.res_content: This track is in my desert island top ten.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This track is in my desert island top ten.

auth_sentence.content: Much of the country is desert or desert scrub.
auth_sentence.res_content: Much of the country is desert or desert scrub.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Much of the country is desert or desert scrub.

stems_affixes.word_buile: assert[v.断言,宣称;坚持;主张[权利,权威等]]+ive……的→adj.言语果断的,断言的
de离开+sert加入,插入,连接→不再加入→抛弃→沙漠[无连接,联系的地方]
insert[v.插入,嵌入;登载 n.插入物]+ion表名词→n.插入,插入物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 断言,宣称;坚持;主张[权利,权威等]
stems_affixes.word_buile: as加强+sert加入,插入,连接→强行加入[观点]→断言
de离开+sert加入,插入,连接→不再加入→抛弃→沙漠[无连接,联系的地方]
ex出,表示超出+sert加入,插入,连接→exert尽[力],努力
ex出+sert加入,插入,连接→插出去→突出

Sentence.sentence: Hospital workers in at least one case deserted their workplace in panic, thus halting the administering of potentially unclean disease spreading injections, but Ebola has not disappeared.

sentences.en: Vast areas of land have become desert.
sentences.cn: 大片的土地已变成沙漠。

sentences.en: Few kinds of plants grow in the desert.
sentences.cn: 几乎没有植物在沙漠上生长。

sentences.en: Never desert a friend in need.
sentences.cn: 决不要抛弃有困难的朋友。

means.word_mean: 擅离(职守、工作岗位、现役等)；(士兵)逃亡，从…开小差

sentences.en: The young soldier deserted the army.
sentences.cn: 那名年轻战士从军队里开了小差。

means.word_mean: (在需要时刻)背离，离去，(当最危急时)舍弃(某人)，(当最需要时)使(某人)失望

sentences.en: None of her friends had deserted her.
sentences.cn: 她的朋友都没有背离她。

means.word_mean: (逃避责任、职责、舍弃义务等)逃跑，逃亡，开小差，当逃兵，擅离职守(有时与from，to连用)

sentences.en: Many soldiers deserted during the battle.
sentences.cn: 在那次战斗中许多士兵开小差了。

jushi.english: The town used to be a cultural desert.
jushi.chinese: 那个城市过去是一座文化沙漠。

jushi.english: The new nation is hoping to reclaim much of its land from the desert.
jushi.chinese: 这个新建立的国家希望从沙漠中开垦出许多土地。

jushi.english: We gazed out over the limitless expanses of the desert.
jushi.chinese: 我们凝望着那一片漫无边际的沙漠。
